objectives.a: Recognise sampling variability and use appropriate tools to describe variability drawing inferences about the population from the sample
objectives.b: Use the concept of margin of error and understand that an increased confidence level implies wider intervals
objectives.c: Construct 95% confidence intervals for the population mean from a large sample and for the population proportion, in both cases using z-tables
objectives.d: Conduct an hypothesis test for a population proportion using confidence intervals
objectives.e: Perform univariate large sample hypothesis tests of the population mean (two tailed z-test only)

objectives.a: Find the equation of a circle with centre (0,0) and radius length r
objectives.b: Find the equation of a circle with centre (h,k) and radius length r
objectives.c: Work with equations of the form $$x^2 + y^2 + 2gx + 2fy + c = 0$$
objectives.d: Calculate the points of intersection of a line and a circle

objectives.a: Prove that a line is a tangent to a circle
objectives.b: Prove that a line does not intersect a circle
objectives.c: Show whether a point is inside, outside or on a circle
objectives.d: Find the equation of tangents to a circle
